properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 3:31PM EST by NWS Marquette MI
properties.description:
Later tonight, winds coming from the southwest will increase in
speed as a strong pocket of winds just above the surface tracks
across the region. Sustained winds are expected to remain around
15 to 20 mph with wind gusts approaching 30 to 40 mph at times,
especially in more open and exposed areas. Locations across the
higher terrain of Marquette and Baraga counties, and communities
along the Lake Superior shoreline will have the potential to see
higher gusts up to 45 mph.

The combination of colder temperatures and these gusty winds will
cause wind chill values to fall to 5 to 15 below zero, with the
coldest conditions expected between 9 PM EST and 4 AM EST. If you
plan on spending time outside tonight, dress in warm layers and
prepare for blustery conditions. With some fresh snow on the
ground, it is possible these gusty winds may cause some blowing
and drifting snow, especially in locations that are more open and
exposed to southwest winds.

Also, ice in and along the shoreline of Lake Superior may become
unstable, or even push offshore due to the brisk southwest winds
expected.

Please visit weather.gov/up for the latest weather information.

NWSheadline: GUSTY SOUTHWEST WINDS ESPECIALLY LATE TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING
